image.altText: A group photo in black and white of mostly women in uniform

items.synopsis: In a suburban Brisbane garage, young women decoded radio transmissions that changed the course of World War II. For the first time, their top-secret work on a panicked Japanese cable about a new type of weapon can be revealed.

title.children: 'Don't tell anybody': The women who gave up retail jobs to become top-secret codebreakers

image.altText: Rescuers scale the wreck of a train carriage tipped on its side.

items.synopsis: At least 50 people are killed and 350 others injured after two trains collided in eastern India.

title.children: 'Grave accident': At least 50 killed as two trains collide in eastern India

image.altText: Close-up of man

items.synopsis: Swirling through the many issues raised by the Ben Roberts-Smith case are the complex problems of collective and individual responsibility – and the dangers in politics of wrapping yourself in the glory of military action, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: The fallout from the Ben Roberts-Smith case is only just beginning

image.altText: A woman stands next to a stripper pole with the words 'tip me' written on her sunglass lenses

items.synopsis: In New Zealand, a collective of strip club dancers has moved a dispute with their employer out into the open to fight for protections for all gig workers.

title.children: A group of strip club dancers came together to fight for better conditions. Now they could change NZ

image.altText: A young woman looks serious, standing in front of a bronze statue of a girl walking on a beam.

items.synopsis: Naomi Lee was abused by her elite gymnastics coaches between the ages of 11 and 14. The Australian Sports Commission will now compensate her for the psychological harm she suffered.

title.children: When she was younger, Naomi was abused by her coaches at the AIS. Now she's receiving compensation

image.altText: Anthony Albanese walks past an honour guard of Singapore armed forces personnel in white dress uniforms.

items.synopsis: Tensions have again been rising between Beijing and Washington, prompting the prime minister to use his keynote address at a peak regional security summit to call for improved dialogue between the two powers as a precondition for peace.

title.children: Anthony Albanese addresses China-US tensions at region's peak security forum

items.synopsis: Players and families at the centre of the Hawthorn cultural safety review have penned an open letter about their experience as they officially lodge a complaint with the Australian Human Rights Commission.

title.children: Cyril Rioli, other former Hawthorn players release open letter saying they were 'betrayed' by club

image.altText: A silhouetted couple stand before a crowd of people with sparklers being waved in a blurry scene.

items.synopsis: Why does wedding gift etiquette elicit such strong feelings? And is there a "magic number" to help make the decision easier?

title.children: 'I've made a huge mistake': Why Sarah felt guilty after giving her friend a wedding present

image.altText: A woman holds sheets of paper in an office.

items.synopsis: A few weeks ago when the prime minister announced funding for a "multipurpose stadium" in Hobart, some people claimed Utopia — a satirical show about government bureaucracy — had predicted the future. It's not the first time it's happened.

title.children: Celia Pacquola still amazed when Utopia predicts real-life bureaucratic absurdities

image.altText: Matchmakers Preeti and Heena

items.synopsis: Preeti and Heena run a matchmaking service in Sydney – and their services are in high demand, particularly among young men who want to settle down.

title.children: Meet Preeti and Heena – Indian matchmakers set on finding the love of your life

image.altText: Mickey Mouse toy caught in a huge trap

items.synopsis: The Florida governor has been feuding with the "House of Mouse" for more than a year — and it all started with a law colloquially known as "Don't Say Gay".

title.children: Who is Ron DeSantis and why does he want to take down Disney?

image.altText: Lizzo smiling and wearing a gold top

items.synopsis: Grammy Award-winning artist Lizzo has had enough of social media hate over her body — something the Butterfly Foundation says can have detrimental effects on mental and physical health.

title.children: Pop star Lizzo hits back at Twitter trolls who are way too comfortable talking about her body

image.altText: A Black woman in her late 20s with curly hair and red top, bright lights in the night behind her

items.synopsis: After struggling to find work in Australia, the actor made her name on beloved American TV series The Bold Type. Now, she’s found her voice and returned home.

title.children: 'I was absolutely terrified': Why actor Aisha Dee called out the producers of her dream gig

image.altText: Fort Liberty sign displayed outside the US Army base.

items.synopsis: The change is part of a broad Department of Defense initiative, motivated by the 2020 George Floyd protests, to rename military installations that had honoured Confederate soldiers.

title.children: US Army base renamed to move on from Confederate legacy

image.altText: A composite image of Kim Cattrall and Sarah Jessica Parker

items.synopsis: After many bitter protests, actor Kim Cattrall will now appear in the second series of And Just Like That. It is the firework this damp squib needs to get off the ground. But it holds important insights about troubled female friendships, too, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: Kim Cattrall's candour about the shock end to friendships may be just what women need

image.altText: An historic photo of a 36-year-old man's face. He has green eyes and a goatee.

items.synopsis: A witness in a murder trial says he heard the co-accused pair say several times they "should kill' Shane Barker — but also concedes he was, at one stage, "suspect number one" himself.

title.children: 'Shoot the bastard': Witness tells murder trial he heard accused couple say they 'should kill' Shane Barker

image.altText: police load evidence into a van

items.synopsis: The 45-year-old man, who was found with critical stab wounds, is currently under police guard in hospital.

title.children: Father charged with murder after allegedly stabbing 3yo son in Sydney's south

image.altText: A man wearing dark glasses walking outdoors with his head bowed.

items.synopsis: A woman claiming the former Sydney school teacher groomed her into a sexual relationship when she was 16 years old has an emotional outburst in the final minutes of her cross-examination.

title.children: Chris Dawson's accuser breaks down in Sydney court at suggestion she's 'making things up'

image.altText: Destroyed vehicles sit next to a dirt road with residential buildings in the background.

items.synopsis: A town in Russia only 15 kilometres from Ukraine's northern Kharkiv region is hit by shells that strike passing cars and kill two women, and China says it is considering another mission to promote peace between Kyiv and Moscow.

title.children: Russia says two killed by Ukrainian shelling of border region, China considers another peace mission

image.altText: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny gestures as he stands in a cage in the Babuskinsky District Court.

items.synopsis: Alexei Navalny, Russia's most famous opposition leader, shares letters showing how he has poked fun at prison authorities with requests for a kimono, a balalaika, a beetle and even a kangaroo.

title.children: 'Can I have a kangaroo?': Jailed Navalny taunts Russian prison with bizarre requests

image.altText: A man in a suit looking down

items.synopsis: Ben Roberts-Smith resigns from his job at Seven West Media, as the company's billionaire chairman Kerry Stokes says the imputations found to be true in yesterday's crushing court judgement do "not accord with the man I know".

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith resigns from Seven as war crimes judgement reverberates around globe

image.altText: An unidentifiable woman in a wheelchair at home on her own.

items.synopsis: The federal government is working on a new law to explicitly make it illegal to charge more for products and services because a client is on the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

title.children: 'Shouldn't view the NDIS as a chance to build a verandah on their beach house': Government announces crackdown on inflated prices for NDIS services

items.synopsis: A 5.75 per cent boost to award wages is massive and will affect millions of workers. But inflation means they'll still have less to spend, writes Daniel Ziffer.

title.children: Inflation means only rare workers are getting ahead, despite award wage boost

image.altText: A Queensland State of Origin player walks around the pitch with a trainer after leaving play during a State of Origin game.

items.synopsis: Queensland's brief moment of having 14 men on the field in Origin I gets costlier, with the NRL issuing the QRL with a breach notice and a proposed $30,000 fine.

title.children: NRL issues breach notice, fine to QRL over Maroons' Origin 14 men on field

image.altText: Unidentified woman looking out of her window.

items.synopsis: The neighbour of a Tasmanian woman who starved to death in her own home says the 71-year-old was let down by those who should have stepped in to help her.

title.children: 'Nobody cared to do anything': Suzie says she tried to get help for neighbour who starved to death

image.altText: A tall man in military uniform speaks with Queen Elizabeth in an ornate room

items.synopsis: Once a hero to politicians and civilians alike, a court found the 44-year-old's reputation is now so lowered that two unproven allegations of battlefield murder weren't enough to defame him.

title.children: From 'Australian hero' to 'disgracing' his country — inside a decorated soldier's massive fall

image.altText: Several photographers point cameras at a man, who is standing, looking on.

items.synopsis: The memorial says it will continue to display disgraced war veteran Ben Roberts-Smith's uniform and medals for now, but will consider adding context.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith's memorabilia to remain on display at Australian War Memorial

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis gestures with his hand

items.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis has bowed out of the French Open with a frustrating third-round loss, ending Australia's singles hopes at the Paris clay-court grand slam.

title.children: Thanasi Kokkinakis fumes over toilet break in French Open defeat

image.altText: Raiders players celebrate

items.synopsis: Canberra survives a furious fightback from the Wests Tigers to secure a dramatic 20-19 NRL victory at Campbelltown.

title.children: Late Raiders penalty breaks Wests Tigers hearts after dramatic fightback

image.altText: A Melbourne AFL player points to fans in celebration as his teammates congratulate him after a goal.

items.synopsis: It's far from a shootout at the MCG, but the Demons get over the line, downing Carlton with a vital win to maintain their spot in the top four.

title.children: Demons snap losing streak with narrow win over Blues

image.altText: Stacey Gaspero in her backyard.

items.synopsis: A local business in Tasmania began mowing lawns free of charge after noticing a lot of clients simply couldn't afford their services — for Stacey Gaspero, it may just have saved her from being evicted.

title.children: Stacey's garden was so overgrown she feared eviction — then a stranger stepped in

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

items.synopsis: The government's proposal is expected to increase the pay of about 2 per cent of its workforce. These charts show exactly who those staff are.

title.children: Which public servants will receive salary boosts under the plan to fix pay gaps?
